Ingredients.1: 1 pound medium-hot red chile peppers, such as Fresnos or red jalapenos

Ingredients.2: 2 small red or orange bell peppers - stemmed, seeded, ribs removed

Directions.1: Wearing rubber or latex gloves, trim tops off chiles. Working in batches, pulse chiles, bell peppers, and onion in a food processor until finely chopped, about 1 minute per batch. Transfer to a nonreactive 3-quart pot.

Directions.2: Stir sugar, vinegar, and pickling salt into chile mixture; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring more frequently toward the end of cooking to prevent scorching, until thickened, 20 to 30 minutes.

Directions.3: Ladle relish into wide-mouth, 1/2-pint jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Wipe the rims clean with a damp paper towel. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.

Directions.4: Screw on the lids and store in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 weeks or the freezer for up to 6 months.
